reviewText: This History Channel Series,makes maximum use of a small budget.Filmed in the Balkins with an unknown cast,helps the History Channel get a lot of bang for the buck.While some weaknesses like the Roman Soldiers wear the same outfits,over a six century period of time;making a single set of generic armor saves budget dollars. These kind of productions,by their very nature' are shoestring affairs.But interesting stunt work and more than acceptable sets are in evidence here.For a quick introduction to late classical and early middle ages tribal upheavals, this set is hard to beat.May not satisfy serious scholars, but a good entre to this historical period. Also narration by veteran voice-over actor Clancy Brown, is also a plus.
summary: Big value on a micro budget
Title: N/A

reviewText: the biggest complaint i have is that each episode looks , sounds the same..and each is too "Generic". Plus it is usual history channel style of narration and just irritating and "movie like" to listen to and many of the American commentators just seem arrogant and superficial understanding. (nothing against Americans in general..but the education style and system is really not up to par with British and European. )
summary: For what there is available on this subject via documentary..it is "alright"..but still not very good
Title: N/A

reviewText: I was waiting for this series the day it came out and looked for it at several stores before finally getting it...This series is just amazing and the release of both the barbarians 1 and 2 on the history classics series is my personal dream come true..Get ready for the ride of your life as this series takes you back in time to the days of the barbarian hordes.. In a sweet 6 1/2 hours this takes you on a historic journey to the time of the Huns, vikings, Goths, Mongols, Vandals, Saxons, Franks, and Lombards!History gives you your moneys worth on this release with non stop excitement and action.. This release onto the history classic series is my personal favorite thus far because not only do you get all that I mentioned but you also get a huge bonus of special features to go along with it..Special features include: Genghis Khan:terror and conquest from A & E biography..  behind the shield ...Conquest: weapons of the Barbarians.. Then Modern Marvels: Axes, Swords & knivesLastly: My personal note...I have picked up almost all of the History Classics dvd's which for 15 to 20 bucks you can't go wrong especially being that none are less than 6 hours of documentary footage with the maximum being about 10 hours..Some of those aren't the best documentaries because many are collections from different documentary series but this is the original barbarians 1 and 2 so you know now that you are getting both original series with extras...I love this series so much that I could go on and on praising it so I will leave you with my advice that if you love this genre of documentary then look no further...BARBARIANS!!!! Thank you history
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a great classic from the history channel, no complaints.  The problem is that if you buy the set "Barbarians 2", you're basically buying this season with an extra tribe or two.  If you want to buy this, buy Barbarians 2.
summary: Buy Barbarians 2 if you're going to buy this!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I don't know what it is about History Channel DVDs, but all of them are in windowbox format (black bars on all four sides) as is this DVD set.  When the picture is zoomed using the television zoom feature, the picture becomes pixelated.  In addition to the windowbox problem, the picture for this program is not in HD.  My advise to anyone purchasing programs from the History Channel is to purchase programs in blu ray format only.  Let me say that again.  If you are going to purchase a program from the History Channel, buy it in blu ray format only or you will get a DVD with a small picture and black bars on all sides.  I am very dissapointed in this DVD set because it was a production masterpiece.  I recommend that anyone interested in watching this program to wait for it to air on television and record it because it airs in normal HD widescreen format.
summary: Picture is windowboxed and not in HD
Title: N/A
